Summary: Small dot extremely far off but motion was zigzag unlike any aircraft
trends: There have been 27 other sightings in Gainesville
There were no other sightings in Gainesville on or around November 17th 2009
divs: sighting detailsit was the day of the leonid meteor shower. i was out with my wife in the middle of a playground around 4-5 am star gazing and watching out for meteors. there were other star gazers too. i was looking at a particular star formation\constellation when i noticed one of the 'stars' moving. it was really far off, like a dim star, so it was difficult to point out to my wife. it kept moving in a straight line from west to east across the sky. i was excited because i thought it was a ufo! my wife completely believes in ufos but she reasoned that it might have been a satellite as they are sometimes visible to the naked eye. i was somewhat convinced. however, after a while i noticed another 'star' moving in a similar fashion, this time from south to north. now this one was not moving in a straight line, it was moving in a somewhat zigzag and erratic motion but generally from south to north. now this could not be a satellite as it wasn't moving straight. the distance was too great to have been a plane and why would a plane or satellite move in a zigzag pattern? after sometime it faded away and i lost sight of it. though we would love to see a real ufo up close, i really hope what i saw was a ufo!
